title: Complete Set
content: IsComplete A means all sufficiently large integers are subset sums of A. This is the fundamental property of the problem.

title: Fragile Set
content: IsFragile A means removing any infinite subset destroys completeness. Together with strong completeness, this creates the delicate balance studied in the problem.

title: Graham's Example
content: Graham (1964) showed F_n − (−1)^n is strongly complete and fragile. This Fibonacci-perturbed sequence has ratio → φ and motivates the conjecture.

title: Golden Ratio Threshold
content: If a_{n+1}/a_n > φ for all n, then A is automatically fragile. The golden ratio is the critical growth rate for fragility.

title: Erdős Problem 346
content: If A is lacunary (a_{n+1}/a_n ≥ 1+ε), strongly complete, and fragile, then lim a_{n+1}/a_n = φ = (1+√5)/2.
